data.enText: a number of people or things taken from a larger group and used in tests to provide information about the group

data.chText: 随机抽选出部分学生进行了采访。
data.enText: The interviews were given to a random sample of students.

data.chText: 调查覆盖了有代表性的一些学校。
data.enText: The survey covers a representative sample of schools.
a small amount of a substance taken from a larger amount and tested in order to obtain information about the substance
Samples of the water contained pesticide.

data.chText: （作为标准或代表的）样品，货样
data.enText: a small amount or example of sth that can be looked at or tried to see what it is like

data.chText: “拿一件你做的货样给我看看。”经理说。
data.enText: ‘I'd like to see a sample of your work,’ said the manager.

data.chText: （用于新乐曲中的）节录乐曲，选录乐曲（或声音）
data.enText: a piece of recorded music or sound that is used in a new piece of music
to try a small amount of a particular food to see what it is like; to experience sth for a short time to see what it is like

data.chText: 我第一次品尝到希腊烹饪的美味。
data.enText: I sampled the delights of Greek cooking for the first time.
to test, question, etc., part of sth or of a group of people in order to find out what the rest is like

data.chText: 在被抽样调查的孩子中，12%说他们喜欢猫胜过喜欢狗。
data.enText: 12% of the children sampled said they prefer cats to dogs.

data.chText: 节录，选录（一段音乐或声音，用于新的乐曲中）
data.enText: to record part of a piece of music, or a sound, in order to use it in a new piece of music

means: （用于新乐曲中的）节录乐曲，选录乐曲（或声音）
选录(一段音乐或声音，用于新的乐曲中)

ex.chText: 他的报告重点列举了一些歧视的事例。
ex.enText: His report highlights some instances of discrimination.

ex.chText: 在这一点上她承认他被冤枉了。
ex.enText: In this instance she admitted that he was wronged.

synonyms.bx: 指某个特定情况的例子。

ex.chText: 你能不能给我举个定语从句的例子呢？
ex.enText: Would you please give me an example of an attributive clause?

ex.chText: 这栋大楼是欧洲建筑风格的范例。
ex.enText: This building is a good example of European architecture.

synonyms.bx: 指用来解释、支持某一概括性观点或代表某个群体特点的具体的人、事物等。

ex.chText: 护士取了一份血样去化验。
ex.enText: The nurse took a blood sample for tests.

ex.chText: 他们想看看他的产品的一些样品。
ex.enText: They wanted to see some samples of his products.

synonyms.bx: 指从某一群体中选取出来的一部分人或事物，以供检验并发现有关该群体的信息。

ex.chText: 他的血样已经被送到了医院。
ex.enText: His blood specimen has been sent to the hospital.

ex.chText: 在过去几年里，他收集了几百种岩石标本。
ex.enText: He has collected hundreds of rock specimens in the past few years.

synonyms.bx: 指用于医学化验的血液、尿液或其他体液样本，或其他用于测试、检验的样品，也可指供学习、研究等用的动物、植物、矿物等的实例。

tr: a small part of something intended as representative of the whole
items selected at random from a population and used to test hypotheses about the population
all or part of a natural object that is collected and preserved as an example of its class

value.def: A sample of a substance or product is a small quantity of it that shows you what it is like.

example.ex: You'll receive samples of paint, curtains and upholstery...
example.tran: 你将收到涂料、窗帘、家具垫衬套的样品。
我们正免费发放 2,000 份样品。

example.ex: They asked me to do some sample drawings.

value.def: A sample of a substance is a small amount of it that is examined and analysed scientifically.

example.ex: They took samples of my blood.

value.def: A sample of people or things is a number of them chosen out of a larger group and then used in tests or used to provide information about the whole group.

example.ex: We based our analysis on a random sample of more than 200 males.
example.tran: 我们随机抽查了 200 多名男性，并在此基础上进行分析。

value.def: If you sample food or drink, you taste a small amount of it in order to find out if you like it.

example.ex: We sampled a selection of different bottled waters.
example.tran: 我们品尝了一系列不同品牌的瓶装水。

value.def: If you sample a place or situation, you experience it for a short time in order to find out about it.

example.ex: ...the chance to sample a different way of life.
example.tran: 体验不同生活方式的机会

value.def: When musicians or pieces of their music are sampled, parts of their music are used by other musicians in their own work.

example.ex: I don't actually mind being sampled as long as people give credit where it's due.
example.tran: 只要人们在适当处标明出处，我其实并不在乎自己的音乐被人节录。
